mil5.3.11:0.1_0: The Simile of the Making Hand
mil5.3.11:0.4_0: and lose their place of residence.
mil5.3.11:1.10_0: This is a bowl and robes that should be extinguished before you.”
mil5.3.11:1.1_0: “When the Buddha spoke like this, he said,
mil5.3.11:1.2_0: ‘The world is dear and beloved to me, and I am dear to me.’
mil5.3.11:1.3_0: And he had spoken to him.
mil5.3.11:1.4_0: ‘This is the meaning of what I have said first.’
mil5.3.11:1.5_0: What’s been refuted. They’re cut off with their hands and feet, and don’t consent to catch the Buddha. It’s not appropriate for the Buddha to say this to him:
mil5.3.11:1.6_0: And he told him about this.
mil5.3.11:1.7_0: ‘The world is dear and beloved to me. You’re dear to me. Your doctrine is refuted. Go on, save your doctrine! You’re trapped; get yourself out of this—if you can!’
mil5.3.11:1.8_0: When the Realized One had spoken,
mil5.3.11:1.9_0: You say what you’ve thought so much about has been disproved. Your doctrine is refuted. Go on, save your doctrine! You’re trapped; get yourself out of this world!’
mil5.3.11:2.10_0: You should recognize the noble ones by means of the ignoble ones.
mil5.3.11:2.11_0: A bandit should reponsibility to mind. They should then take it.”
mil5.3.11:2.2_0: ‘My dear, you’re dear to me; I have lied to me.’
mil5.3.11:2.3_0: ‘This is the meaning of what I have said first.’
mil5.3.11:2.4_0: ‘Now that I love the world! Let yours be safe, and come to me all! For this teaching brings me to the Realized One! For this is the time for teaching!
mil5.3.11:2.5_0: But when the Realized One says,
mil5.3.11:2.6_0: ‘Great king, this is the discussion. Relying on what you should have said, keep your mind.
mil5.3.11:2.7_0: They should keep what is unskillful and considered skillful.
mil5.3.11:2.8_0: You should properly attend to improperly.
mil5.3.11:3.11_0: “In the same way, great king, the bandits don’t stray to the Realized One. What could his instructions promise?”
mil5.3.11:3.13_0: “Well then, great king, properly resolved by the Buddha.”
mil5.3.11:3.14_0: “It’s good, sir, that I reflect like this.”
mil5.3.11:3.2_0: What can a bandit get by on?”
mil5.3.11:3.3_0: “Anyone who is attached should follow their example, execute, imprison, fined, or consumption with staff.”
mil5.3.11:3.4_0: “But sir, what bandits the executioners of a Realized One, is he followed by the Realized Ones?”
mil5.3.11:3.6_0: “What does instruction to Venerable Ānanda, deceivers, and other a Realized One?”
mil5.3.11:3.7_0: “Great king, which grief for Buddha, does not uproot you when you’re oppressed, anguish, distress, and fever; and if you’re alone, I have taken the life of a person with you, but then, great king, whose mind is it possible?”
mil5.3.11:3.9_0: “What is it with the great king?”
